template.name: The name displayed during AD Miner execution (Requesting : <name>)
template.request: The neo4j request executed. Don't forget to escape double quotes " :)
template.output_type: The output type stored in neo4j.all_request[request_key]["result"]. list, dict and Graph are supported.
template.is_a_write_request: please specify true here if your request writes to the neo4j database. It allows correct execution in specific parallels modes.
template.scope_query: USE ONLY IF YOU SPECIFIED 'SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2' to parallelize your request. The scope query request should be a neo4j request that returns the total count of elements you then want to SKIP and LIMIT. Ask @snowpeacock if unsure.
template.postProcessing: A python function to call just after your request. You should also define it in the neo4j_class.py file.
template.is_a_gds_request: true if this request returns a gs path and has attributes `create_gds_graph`, `gds_request` and `drop_gds_graph`
template.create_gds_graph: neo4j request to create a neo4j GDS graph. Used only for gds requests
template.gds_request: cypher request to compute path with cost computation
template.gds_scope_query: scope query for the gds request
template.reverse_path: To specify only if you need to return inverted paths, used for specific gds requests
template.drop_gds_graph: cypher request to drop the neo4j GDS graph
template._comment: You can use useless json entries to write comments about your request in this file.
template._comment_2: The following variables should be used in the neo4j request and will be replaced by the python code : $properties$, $extract_date$, $password_renewal$, $recursive_level$, $inbound_control_edges$, $path_to_group_operators_props$.
template._comment_3: The cache file of your neo4j request will be named after its name in this file. The 'filename' attribute is deprecated.

check_if_GDS_installed.name: Checking if Graph Data Science neo4j plugin is installed
check_if_GDS_installed.request: SHOW PROCEDURES YIELD name RETURN 'gds.graph.project' IN COLLECT(name) AND 'gds.shortestPath.dijkstra.stream' IN COLLECT(name) as gds_installed

delete_orphans.name: Delete orphan objects that have no labels
delete_orphans.request: MATCH (n) WHERE labels(n) = ["Base"] OR labels(n) = ["AZBase"] OR labels(n) = ["Base", "AZBase"] DETACH DELETE n

delete_unresolved.name: Delete objects for which SID could not resolved
delete_unresolved.request: MATCH (n) WHERE ((NOT EXISTS(n.domain) AND NOT (n:Domain)) OR NOT EXISTS(n.name)) AND NOT EXISTS(n.tenantid) DETACH DELETE n

set_upper_domain_name.name: Set domain names to upper case when not the case
set_upper_domain_name.request: MATCH (g) where g.domain <> toUpper(g.domain) SET g.domain=toUpper(g.domain)

set_server.name: Set is_server=TRUE to computers for which operatingsystem contains Server)
set_server.request: MATCH (c:Computer)  WHERE c.operatingsystem CONTAINS "erver" SET c.is_server=TRUE

set_non_server.name: Set is_server=FALSE to other computers )
set_non_server.request: MATCH (c:Computer) WHERE c.is_server IS NULL  SET c.is_server=FALSE

set_dc.name: Set dc=TRUE to computers that are domain controllers)
set_dc.request: MATCH (c:Computer)-[:MemberOf*1..3]->(g:Group) WHERE g.objectid ENDS WITH "-516" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-521" SET c.is_dc=TRUE

set_nondc.name: Set dc=FALSE to computers that are not domain controllers)
set_nondc.request: MATCH (c:Computer) WHERE c.is_dc IS NULL SET c.is_dc=FALSE

onpremid_ompremsesecurityidentifier.name: Setting onpremid in case of old collector
onpremid_ompremsesecurityidentifier.request: MATCH (a)  WHERE NOT a.onpremisesecurityidentifier IS NULL set a.onpremid=a.onpremisesecurityidentifier

set_can_extract_dc_secrets.name: ADD CanExtractDCSecrets relation from BACKUP OPERATORS OR SERVER OPERATORS groups to DCs of same domain
set_can_extract_dc_secrets.request: MATCH (g:Group) WHERE g.objectid ENDS WITH "-551" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-549" MATCH (c:Computer{is_dc:true}) WHERE g.domain = c.domain MERGE (g)-[:CanExtractDCSecrets]->(c)

set_unconstrained_delegations.name: ADD UnconstrainedDelegations relation from objects with KUD to the corresponding domain
set_unconstrained_delegations.request: MATCH (m{unconstraineddelegation:true,is_dc:false}) MATCH (d:Domain) WHERE m.domain = d.domain MERGE (m)-[:UnconstrainedDelegations]->(d)

set_is_adminsdholder.name: Set is_adminsdholder to Container with AdminSDHOLDER in name
set_is_adminsdholder.request: MATCH (c:Container) WHERE c.name STARTS WITH "ADMINSDHOLDER@" SET c.is_adminsdholder=true

set_is_dnsadmin.name: Set is_dnsadmin to Group with DNSAdmins in name
set_is_dnsadmin.request: MATCH (g:Group) WHERE g.name STARTS WITH "DNSADMINS@" SET g.is_dnsadmin=true

set_can_load_code.name: ADD CanLoadCode relation from PRINT OPERATORS groups to DCs of same domain
set_can_load_code.request: MATCH (g:Group) WHERE g.objectid ENDS WITH "-550" MATCH (c:Computer{is_dc:true}) WHERE g.domain = c.domain MERGE (g)-[:CanLoadCode]->(c)

set_can_logon_dc.name: ADD CanLogOnLocallyOnDC relation from ACCOUNT OPERATORS groups to DCs of same domain
set_can_logon_dc.request: MATCH (g:Group) WHERE g.objectid ENDS WITH "-548" MATCH (c:Computer{is_dc:true}) WHERE g.domain = c.domain MERGE (g)-[:CanLogOnLocallyOnDC]->(c)

set_da.name: Set da=TRUE to users that are domain admins or administrators or enterprise admin
set_da.request: MATCH (c:User)-[:MemberOf*1..3]->(g:Group) WHERE g.objectid ENDS WITH "-512" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-518" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-519" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-526" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-527" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-544" SET c.is_da=TRUE, c.da_types=[]
set_da._comment: -512 for DA, -518 for Schema admin, -519 for Enterprise Admin, -525 for Protected Users, -526 for Key Admin, -527 for Entreprise Key Admin, -544 for Builtin Admin

set_da_types.name: Set the da type (domain, enterprise, key or builtin)
set_da_types.request: MATCH (c:User)-[:MemberOf*1..3]->(g:Group) WHERE g.objectid ENDS WITH "-512" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-518" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-519" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-525" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-526" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-527" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-544" WITH c,g, CASE WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-512" THEN "Domain Admin" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-518" THEN "Schema Admin" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-519" THEN "Enterprise Admin" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-525" THEN "Protected Users" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-526" THEN "_ Key Admin" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-527" THEN "Enterprise Key Admin" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-544" THEN "Builtin Administrator" ELSE null END AS da_type SET c.da_types = c.da_types + da_type
set_da_types._comment: for unknown reasons checking the whole condition has to be checked twice or it doesn't work
set_da_types._comment2: -512 for DA, -518 for Schema admin, -519 for Enterprise Admin, -525 for Protected Users, -526 for Key Admin, -527 for Entreprise Key Admin, -544 for Builtin Admin

set_dag.name: Set da=TRUE to groups that are domain admins or administrators or enterprise admin
set_dag.request: MATCH (c:Group)-[:MemberOf*1..3]->(g:Group) WHERE g.objectid ENDS WITH "-512" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-518" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-519" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-526" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-527" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-544" SET c.is_da=TRUE
set_dag._comment: -512 for DA, -518 for Schema admin, -519 for Enterprise Admin, -525 for Protected Users, -526 for Key Admin, -527 for Entreprise Key Admin, -544 for Builtin Admin

set_dag_types.name: Set the da type (domain, enterprise, key or builtin)
set_dag_types.request: MATCH (c:Group)-[:MemberOf*1..3]->(g:Group) WHERE g.objectid ENDS WITH "-512" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-518" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-519" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-525" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-526" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-527" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-544" WITH c,g, CASE WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-512" THEN "Domain Admin" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-518" THEN "Schema Admin" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-519" THEN "Enterprise Admin" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-525" THEN "Protected Users" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-526" THEN "_ Key Admin" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-527" THEN "Enterprise Key Admin" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-544" THEN "Builtin Administrator" ELSE null END AS da_type SET c.da_types = c.da_types + da_type
set_dag_types._comment: for unknown reasons checking the whole condition has to be checked twice or it doesn't work
set_dag_types._comment2: -512 for DA, -518 for Schema admin, -519 for Enterprise Admin, -525 for Protected Users, -526 for Key Admin, -527 for Entreprise Key Admin, -544 for Builtin Admin

set_dagg.name: Set da=TRUE to groups that are domain admins or administrators or enterprise admin
set_dagg.request: MATCH (g:Group) WHERE g.objectid ENDS WITH "-512" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-518" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-519" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-526" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-527" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-544" SET g.is_da=TRUE
set_dagg._comment: -512 for DA, -518 for Schema admin, -519 for Enterprise Admin, -525 for Protected Users, -526 for Key Admin, -527 for Entreprise Key Admin, -544 for Builtin Admin

set_dagg_types.name: Set the da type (domain, enterprise, key or builtin)
set_dagg_types.request: MATCH (g:Group) WHERE g.objectid ENDS WITH "-512" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-518" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-519" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-525" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-526" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-527" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-544" WITH g, CASE WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-512" THEN "Domain Admin" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-518" THEN "Schema Admin" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-519" THEN "Enterprise Admin" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-525" THEN "Protected Users" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-526" THEN "_ Key Admin" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-527" THEN "Enterprise Key Admin" WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-544" THEN "Builtin Administrator" ELSE null END AS da_type SET g.da_types = g.da_types + da_type
set_dagg_types._comment: for unknown reasons checking the whole condition has to be checked twice or it doesn't work
set_dagg_types._comment2: -512 for DA, -518 for Schema admin, -519 for Enterprise Admin, -525 for Protected Users, -526 for Key Admin, -527 for Entreprise Key Admin, -544 for Builtin Admin

set_daggg.name: Set dag=TRUE to the exact domain admin group (end with 512)
set_daggg.request: MATCH (g:Group) WHERE g.objectid ENDS WITH "-512"  SET g.is_dag=TRUE

set_nonda.name: Set is_da=FALSE to all objects that do not have is_da=TRUE
set_nonda.request: MATCH (c) WHERE c.is_da IS NULL SET c.is_da=FALSE

set_nondag.name: Set is_dag=FALSE to all objects that do not have is_da=TRUE
set_nondag.request: MATCH (g) WHERE g.is_dag IS NULL SET g.is_dag=FALSE

del_fake_dc_admins.name: Delete AdminTo edges from non-DA to DC

set_is_group_operator.name: Set is_group_operator to Operator Groups (cf: ACCOUNT OPERATORS, SERVER OPERATORS, BACKUP OPERATORS, PRINT OPERATORS)
set_is_group_operator.request: MATCH (g:Group) WHERE g.objectid ENDS WITH "-551" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-549" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-548" OR g.objectid ENDS WITH "-550" SET g.is_group_operator=True SET g.is_group_account_operator = CASE WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-548" THEN true END, g.is_group_backup_operator = CASE WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-551" THEN true END, g.is_group_server_operator = CASE WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-549" THEN true END, g.is_group_print_operator = CASE WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-550" THEN true END
set_is_group_operator._comment: BACKUP OPERATORS ENDS WITH = S-1-5-32-551 | ACCOUNT OPERATORS ENDS WITH =  S-1-5-32-548
set_is_group_operator._comment_2: SERVER OPERATORS ENDS WITH = S-1-5-32-549 | PRINT OPERATORS ENDS WITH   = S-1-5-32-550

set_is_operator_member.name: Set is_operator_member to objects member of Operator Groups (cf: ACCOUNT OPERATORS, SERVER OPERATORS, BACKUP OPERATORS, PRINT OPERATORS)
set_is_operator_member.request: MATCH (o:User)-[r:MemberOf*1..5]->(g:Group{is_group_operator:True}) WHERE o.is_da=false OR o.domain <> g.domain SET o.is_operator_member=true SET o.is_account_operator = CASE WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-548" THEN true ELSE o.is_account_operator END, o.is_type_operator = CASE WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-548" THEN "ACCOUNT OPERATOR" ELSE o.is_type_operator END, o.is_backup_operator = CASE WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-551" THEN true ELSE o.is_backup_operator END, o.is_type_operator = CASE WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-548" THEN "BACKUP OPERATOR" ELSE o.is_type_operator END, o.is_server_operator = CASE WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-549" THEN true ELSE o.is_server_operator END, o.is_type_operator = CASE WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-548" THEN "SERVER OPERATOR" ELSE o.is_type_operator END, o.is_print_operator = CASE WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-550" THEN true ELSE o.is_print_operator END, o.is_type_operator = CASE WHEN g.objectid ENDS WITH "-548" THEN "PRINT OPERATOR" ELSE o.is_type_operator END

set_dcsync1.name: Set dcsync=TRUE to nodes that can DCSync (GetChanges/GetChangesAll)
set_dcsync1.request: MATCH (n1) WITH n1 ORDER BY n1.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p=allShortestPaths((n1)-[:MemberOf|GetChanges*1..5]->(u:Domain)) WHERE n1 <> u WITH n1 MATCH p2=(n1)-[:MemberOf|GetChangesAll*1..5]->(u:Domain) WHERE n1 <> u AND NOT n1.name IS NULL AND (((n1.is_da IS NULL OR n1.is_da=FALSE) AND (n1.is_dc IS NULL OR n1.is_dc=FALSE)) OR (NOT u.domain CONTAINS '.' + n1.domain AND n1.domain <> u.domain)) SET n1.can_dcsync=TRUE RETURN DISTINCT p2 as p

set_dcsync2.name: Set dcsync=TRUE to nodes that can DCSync (GenericAll/AllExtendedRights)
set_dcsync2.request: MATCH (n2) WITH n2 ORDER BY n2.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p3=allShortestPaths((n2)-[:MemberOf|GenericAll|AllExtendedRights*1..5]->(u:Domain)) WHERE n2 <> u AND NOT n2.name IS NULL AND (((n2.is_da IS NULL OR n2.is_da=FALSE) AND (n2.is_dc IS NULL OR n2.is_dc=FALSE)) OR (NOT u.domain CONTAINS '.' + n2.domain AND n2.domain <> u.domain)) SET n2.can_dcsync=TRUE RETURN DISTINCT p3 as p

dcsync_list.name: Get list of objects that can DCsync (and should probably not be to)
dcsync_list.request: MATCH (n{can_dcsync:true}) RETURN n.domain as domain, n.name as name

set_ou_candidate.name: Set ou_candidate=TRUE to candidates eligible to shortestou to DA
set_ou_candidate.request: MATCH (m) WHERE NOT m.name IS NULL AND ((m:Computer AND (m.is_dc=false OR NOT EXISTS(m.is_dc))) OR (m:User AND (m.is_da=false OR NOT EXISTS(m.is_da)))) SET m.ou_candidate=TRUE

set_containsda.name: Set contains_da_dc=TRUE to all objects that contains a domain administrator

set_containsdc.name: Set contains_da_dc=TRUE to all objects that contains a domain controller

set_is_da_dc.name: Set is_da_dc=TRUE to all objects that are domain controller or domain admins
set_is_da_dc.request: MATCH (u) WHERE (u.is_da=true OR u.is_dc=true) SET u.is_da_dc=true

set_is_not_da_dc.name: Set is_da_dc=FALSE to objects without is_da_dc = TRUE
set_is_not_da_dc.request: MATCH (o:Base) WHERE o.is_da_dc IS NULL SET o.is_da_dc = FALSE

set_path_candidate.name: Set path_candidate=TRUE to candidates eligible to shortestPath to DA
set_path_candidate.request: MATCH (o{is_da_dc:false}) WHERE NOT o:Domain AND ((o.enabled=True AND o:User) OR NOT o:User) SET o.path_candidate=TRUE

set_groups_members_count.name: Set members_count to groups (recursivity = 5)
set_groups_members_count.request: MATCH  (g:Group) WITH g ORDER BY g.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH (u:User)-[:MemberOf*1..5]->(g) WHERE NOT u.name IS NULL AND NOT g.name IS NULL WITH g AS g1, count(u) AS memberscount SET g1.members_count=memberscount
set_groups_members_count._comment: Recursivity = 5 seems the good match for ratio results/time when searching MemberOf*1..X when using our servers (else 3)

set_groups_has_members.name: Set has_member=True to groups with member, else false
set_groups_has_members.request: MATCH (g:Group) SET g.has_members=(CASE WHEN g.members_count>0 THEN TRUE ELSE FALSE END)

set_gpo_links_count.name: Set the count of links/object where the GPO is applied
set_gpo_links_count.request: MATCH p=(g:GPO)-[:GPLink]->(o) WITH g.name as gponame, count(p) AS gpolinkscount MATCH (g1:GPO) WHERE g1.name=gponame AND gpolinkscount IS NOT NULL SET g1.gpolinks_count=gpolinkscount

set_gpos_has_links.name: Set has_links=True to GPOs with links, else false
set_gpos_has_links.request: MATCH (g:GPO) SET g.has_links=(CASE WHEN g.gpolinks_count>0 THEN TRUE ELSE FALSE END)

set_is_adcs.name: Set is_adcs to ADCS servers
set_is_adcs.request: MATCH (g:Group) WHERE g.objectid ENDS WITH '-517' MATCH (c:Computer)-[r:MemberOf*1..4]->(g) SET c.is_adcs=TRUE RETURN c.domain AS domain, c.name AS name

set_groups_direct_admin.name: Set groups which are direct admins of computers
set_groups_direct_admin.request: MATCH (g:Group)-[r:AdminTo]->(c:Computer) SET g.is_admin=true RETURN DISTINCT g
set_groups_direct_admin._comment: This block of requests aims at optimizing the path requests by tagging interesting nodes

set_groups_indirect_admin_1.name: 1 - Set groups which are indirect admins of computers, ie. admins of admin groups (see precedent request)
set_groups_indirect_admin_1.request: MATCH (g:Group)-[r:MemberOf]->(gg:Group{is_admin:true}) SET g.is_admin=true RETURN DISTINCT g

set_groups_indirect_admin_2.name: 2 - Set groups which are indirect admins of computers, ie. admins of admin groups (see precedent request)
set_groups_indirect_admin_2.request: MATCH (g:Group{is_admin:false})-[r:MemberOf]->(gg:Group{is_admin:true}) SET g.is_admin=true RETURN DISTINCT g

set_groups_indirect_admin_3.name: 3 - Set groups which are indirect admins of computers, ie. admins of admin groups (see precedent request)
set_groups_indirect_admin_3.request: MATCH (g:Group{is_admin:false})-[r:MemberOf]->(gg:Group{is_admin:true}) SET g.is_admin=true RETURN DISTINCT g

set_groups_indirect_admin_4.name: 4 - Set groups which are indirect admins of computers, ie. admins of admin groups (see precedent request)
set_groups_indirect_admin_4.request: MATCH (g:Group{is_admin:false})-[r:MemberOf]->(gg:Group{is_admin:true}) SET g.is_admin=true RETURN DISTINCT g

set_target_kud.name: Set target_kud attribute on nodes that are configured for KUD
set_target_kud.request: MATCH (o{unconstraineddelegation:true}) WHERE ((o:User AND o.enabled=true) OR (o:Computer AND o.is_dc=false)) SET o.target_kud=TRUE

set_synced_OP_user_AZ_user.name: Set relationships between On premiser User and Azure User
set_synced_OP_user_AZ_user.request: MATCH (a:AZUser),(u:User) WHERE a.onpremid = u.objectid MERGE (a)-[:Synced]->(u) MERGE (u)-[:Synced]->(a)

get_count_of_member_admin_group.name: Count number of users in group
get_count_of_member_admin_group.request: MATCH (u:User{enabled:true})-[r:MemberOf]->(gg:Group{is_admin:true}) WHERE NOT u.name IS NULL and NOT gg.name IS NULL WITH count(u) as count, gg as g MATCH (g) SET g.user_members_count=count

get_users_linked_admin_group.name: Returns all users member of an admin group
get_users_linked_admin_group.request: MATCH (u:User{enabled:true})-[r:MemberOf]->(gg:Group{is_admin:true}) WHERE NOT u.name IS NULL and NOT gg.name IS NULL SET u.is_admin=true RETURN u, gg, ID(u) as idu, ID(gg) as idg

get_groups_linked_admin_group.name: Returns all groups member of an admin group
get_groups_linked_admin_group.request: MATCH (g:Group)-[r:MemberOf]->(gg:Group{is_admin:true}) WHERE NOT g.name IS NULL and NOT gg.name IS NULL RETURN g, gg, ID(g) as idg, ID(gg) as idgg

get_computers_linked_admin_group.name: Returns all computers administrated by an admin group
get_computers_linked_admin_group.request: MATCH (g:Group{is_admin:true})-[r:AdminTo]->(c:Computer) WHERE NOT c.name IS NULL and NOT g.name IS NULL RETURN g, c, ID(g) as idg, ID(c) as idc

get_users_direct_admin.name: Return direct admin users
get_users_direct_admin.request: MATCH (g:User{enabled:true})-[r:AdminTo]->(c:Computer) WHERE NOT g.name IS NULL and NOT c.name IS NULL SET g.is_admin=True RETURN g, c, ID(g) as idg, ID(c) as idc

set_ghost_computer.name: Set ghost_computer=TRUE to computers that did not login for more than 90 days

set_default_exploitability_rating.name: Set default exploitability rating (r.cost=100) to all relations

check_unknown_relations.name: Checking for unknown relations
check_unknown_relations.request: MATCH ()-[r]->() RETURN DISTINCT type(r) as relationType

domains.name: List of domains
domains.request: MATCH (m:Domain) RETURN DISTINCT(m.name) AS domain ORDER BY m.name

nb_domain_controllers.name: Number of domain controllers
nb_domain_controllers.request: MATCH (c1:Computer{is_dc:TRUE}) RETURN DISTINCT(c1.domain) AS domain, c1.name AS name, COALESCE(c1.operatingsystem, 'Unknown') AS os, COALESCE(c1.ghost_computer, False) AS ghost, toInteger(($extract_date$ - c1.lastlogontimestamp)/86400) as lastLogon

domain_OUs.name: Domain Organisational Units
domain_OUs.request: MATCH (o:OU)-[:Contains]->(c) RETURN o.name AS OU, c.name AS name

users_shadow_credentials.name: Non privileged users that can impersonate privileged users
users_shadow_credentials.request: MATCH (u:User{enabled:true,is_da:false}) WITH u ORDER BY u.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p=allShortestPaths((u)-[r:MemberOf|AddKeyCredentialLink|WriteProperty|GenericAll|GenericWrite|Owns|WriteDacl*1..3]->(m:User{is_da:true,enabled:true})) RETURN p

users_shadow_credentials_to_non_admins.name: Non privileged users that can be impersonated by non privileged users
users_shadow_credentials_to_non_admins.request: CALL {MATCH (s:User{enabled:true, is_da:false}) RETURN s UNION ALL MATCH (s:Group{is_dag:false,is_da:false}) RETURN s} WITH s ORDER BY s.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p=shortestPath((s)-[r:AddKeyCredentialLink|WriteProperty|GenericAll|GenericWrite|Owns|WriteDacl*1..3]->(t:User{enabled:true})) WHERE s <> t RETURN p
users_shadow_credentials_to_non_admins.scope_query: CALL {MATCH (s:User{enabled:true, is_da:false}) RETURN s UNION ALL MATCH (s:Group{is_dag:false,is_da:false}) RETURN s} WITH s ORDER BY s.name RETURN count(s)

nb_enabled_accounts.name: Number of domain accounts enabled
nb_enabled_accounts.request: MATCH p=(u:User{enabled:true} ) RETURN DISTINCT(u.domain) AS domain, u.name AS name, toInteger(($extract_date$ - u.lastlogontimestamp)/86400) AS logon ORDER BY u.domain

nb_disabled_accounts.name: Number of domain accounts disabled
nb_disabled_accounts.request: MATCH p=(u:User{enabled:false} ) RETURN DISTINCT(u.domain) AS domain, u.name AS name, toInteger(($extract_date$ - u.lastlogontimestamp)/86400) AS logon ORDER BY u.domain

nb_groups.name: Number of groups
nb_groups.request: MATCH p=(g:Group) WHERE NOT g.name IS NULL AND NOT g.domain IS NULL RETURN DISTINCT(g.domain) AS domain, g.name AS name, g.is_da AS da ORDER BY g.domain

nb_computers.name: Number of computers
nb_computers.request: MATCH (c:Computer) WHERE NOT c.name IS NULL RETURN DISTINCT(c.domain) AS domain, c.name AS name, c.operatingsystem AS os, c.ghost_computer AS ghost ORDER BY c.domain

computers_not_connected_since.name: Computers not connected since
computers_not_connected_since.request: MATCH (c:Computer) WHERE NOT c.lastlogontimestamp IS NULL AND c.name IS NOT NULL RETURN c.name AS name, toInteger(($extract_date$ - c.lastlogontimestamp)/86400) as days, toInteger(($extract_date$ - c.pwdlastset)/86400) as pwdlastset, c.enabled as enabled ORDER BY days DESC

nb_domain_admins.name: Number of domain admin accounts
nb_domain_admins.request: MATCH (n{enabled:true}) WHERE n.is_da = TRUE RETURN n.domain AS domain, n.name AS name, n.da_types AS `admin type`, n.admincount AS `admincount`

os.name: Number of OS
os.request: MATCH (c:Computer{enabled:true}) WHERE  NOT c.enabled IS NULL AND NOT c.operatingsystem IS NULL RETURN DISTINCT(c.operatingsystem) AS os, toInteger(($extract_date$ - c.lastlogontimestamp)/86400) as lastLogon, c.name AS name, c.domain AS domain ORDER BY c.operatingsystem

krb_pwd_last_change.name: Kerberos password last change in days
krb_pwd_last_change.request: MATCH(u:User) WHERE u.name STARTS WITH "KRBTGT@" RETURN u.domain as domain, u.name as name, toInteger(($extract_date$ - u.pwdlastset)/86400) as pass_last_change, toInteger(($extract_date$ - u.whencreated)/86400) AS accountCreationDate

nb_kerberoastable_accounts.name: Number of Kerberoastable accounts
nb_kerberoastable_accounts.request: MATCH (u:User{hasspn:true,enabled:true}) WHERE u.name IS NOT NULL RETURN u.domain AS domain, u.name AS name, toInteger(($extract_date$ - u.pwdlastset)/86400) AS pass_last_change, u.is_da AS is_Domain_Admin, u.serviceprincipalnames AS SPN, toInteger(($extract_date$ - u.whencreated)/86400) AS accountCreationDate ORDER BY pass_last_change DESC

nb_as-rep_roastable_accounts.name: Number of AS-REP Roastable accounts
nb_as-rep_roastable_accounts.request: MATCH (u:User{enabled:true,dontreqpreauth: true}) RETURN u.domain AS domain,u.name AS name, u.is_da AS is_Domain_Admin

nb_computer_unconstrained_delegations.name: Number of machines with unconstrained delegations
nb_computer_unconstrained_delegations.request: MATCH (c2:Computer{unconstraineddelegation:true,is_dc:FALSE}) RETURN DISTINCT(c2.domain) AS domain,c2.name AS name

nb_users_unconstrained_delegations.name: Number of users with unconstrained delegations
nb_users_unconstrained_delegations.request: MATCH (c2:User{enabled:true,unconstraineddelegation:true,is_da:FALSE}) RETURN DISTINCT(c2.domain) AS domain,c2.name AS name

users_constrained_delegations.name: Number of users with constrained delegations
users_constrained_delegations.request: MATCH (u:User)-[:AllowedToDelegate]->(c:Computer) WHERE u.name IS NOT NULL AND c.name IS NOT NULL RETURN u.name AS name, c.name AS computer,c.is_dc as to_DC ORDER BY name

dormant_accounts.name: Dormant accounts
dormant_accounts.request: MATCH (n:User{enabled:true}) WHERE toInteger(($extract_date$ - n.lastlogontimestamp)/86400)>$password_renewal$ RETURN n.domain as domain, n.name as name,toInteger(($extract_date$ - n.lastlogontimestamp)/86400) AS days, toInteger(($extract_date$ - n.whencreated)/86400) AS accountCreationDate ORDER BY days DESC

password_last_change.name: Password last change in days
password_last_change.request: MATCH (c:User {enabled:TRUE}) RETURN DISTINCT(c.name) AS user,toInteger(($extract_date$ - c.pwdlastset )/ 86400) AS days, toInteger(($extract_date$ - c.whencreated)/86400) AS accountCreationDate ORDER BY days DESC

nb_user_password_cleartext.name: Number of accounts where password cleartext password is populated
nb_user_password_cleartext.request: MATCH (u:User) WHERE NOT u.userpassword IS null RETURN u.name AS user,"[redacted for security purposes]" AS password, u.is_da as `is Domain Admin`

get_users_password_not_required.name: Number of accounts where password is not required
get_users_password_not_required.request: MATCH (u:User{enabled:true,passwordnotreqd:true}) RETURN DISTINCT (u.domain) as domain, (u.name) AS user,toInteger(($extract_date$ - u.pwdlastset )/ 86400) AS pwdlastset,toInteger(($extract_date$ - u.lastlogontimestamp)/86400) AS lastlogon

objects_admincount.name: N objects have AdminSDHolder
objects_admincount.request: MATCH (n{enabled:True, admincount:True}) RETURN n.domain as domain, labels(n) as type, n.name as name
objects_admincount._comment: FIXME: the UNION is messing up the AS and breaks the grid 'UNION MATCH (n{admincount:true}) RETURN n.domain as domain, labels(n) as type, n.name as name',

user_password_never_expires.name: Password never expired
user_password_never_expires.request: MATCH (u:User{enabled:true})WHERE u.pwdneverexpires = true RETURN DISTINCT(u.domain) AS domain, u.name AS name, toInteger(($extract_date$ - u.lastlogontimestamp)/86400) AS LastLogin, toInteger(($extract_date$ - u.pwdlastset )/ 86400) AS LastPasswChange,toInteger(($extract_date$ - u.whencreated)/86400) AS accountCreationDate

computers_members_high_privilege.name: High privilege group computer member
computers_members_high_privilege.request: MATCH(c:Computer{is_dc:false})-[r:MemberOf*1..4]->(g:Group{highvalue:true}) WHERE NOT c.name IS NULL RETURN distinct(c.name) AS computer, g.name AS group, g.domain AS domain

objects_to_domain_admin.name: Objects with path to DA
objects_to_domain_admin.create_gds_graph: CALL gds.graph.project.cypher('graph_objects_to_domain_admin', 'MATCH (n) RETURN id(n) AS id', 'MATCH (n)-[r:$properties$]->(m) RETURN id(m) as source, id(n) AS target, r.cost as cost', {validateRelationships: false})
objects_to_domain_admin.request: MATCH (m{path_candidate:true}) WHERE NOT m.name IS NULL WITH m ORDER BY m.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p = shortestPath((m)-[r:$properties$*1..$recursive_level$]->(g:Group{is_dag:true})) WHERE m<>g SET m.has_path_to_da=true RETURN DISTINCT(p) as p
objects_to_domain_admin.gds_request: MATCH (target:Group {is_dag: true}) CALL gds.allShortestPaths.dijkstra.stream('graph_objects_to_domain_admin', {sourceNode: target, relationshipWeightProperty: 'cost', logProgress: false}) YIELD path WITH nodes(path)[-1] AS starting_node, path WHERE starting_node.path_candidate = TRUE SET starting_node.has_path_to_da=true RETURN path as p
objects_to_domain_admin.scope_query: MATCH (m{path_candidate:true}) WHERE NOT m.name IS NULL RETURN count(m)

objects_to_adcs.name: Objects with path to ADCS servers
objects_to_adcs.request: MATCH (o{path_candidate:true}) WHERE NOT o.name IS NULL WITH o ORDER BY o.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p=(o)-[rrr:MemberOf*1..4]->(gg:Group)-[rr:AdminTo]->(c) WHERE c.is_adcs = TRUE RETURN DISTINCT(p) as p
objects_to_adcs.scope_query: MATCH (m{path_candidate:true}) WHERE NOT m.name IS NULL RETURN count(m)

users_admin_on_computers.name: Users admin on machines
users_admin_on_computers.request: MATCH p=(n:User{enabled:true})-[r:MemberOf|AdminTo*1..4]->(m:Computer) WHERE n:User AND n.enabled=true RETURN distinct(n.name) AS user,m.name AS computer,m.has_path_to_da AS has_path_to_da

users_admin_on_servers_1.name: Users admin on servers n°1
users_admin_on_servers_1.request: MATCH p=(n:User{enabled:true,is_da:false}) WHERE NOT n.name IS NULL MATCH (n)-[r:MemberOf*1..4]->(g:Group)-[r1:$properties$]->(u:Computer) WITH LENGTH(p) as pathLength, p, n, u SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 WHERE NONE (x in NODES(p)[1..(pathLength-1)] WHERE x.objectid = u.objectid) AND NOT n.objectid = u.objectid RETURN n.name AS user, u.name AS computer, u.has_path_to_da as has_path_to_da
users_admin_on_servers_1.scope_query: MATCH (n:User{enabled:true,is_da:false}) WHERE NOT n.name IS NULL RETURN count(n)

users_admin_on_servers_2.name: Users admin on servers n°2
users_admin_on_servers_2.request: MATCH p=(n:User{enabled:true,is_da:false}) WHERE NOT n.name IS NULL MATCH (n)-[r1:$properties$]->(u:Computer) WITH LENGTH(p) as pathLength, p, n, u SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 WHERE NONE (x in NODES(p)[1..(pathLength-1)] WHERE x.objectid = u.objectid) AND NOT n.objectid = u.objectid RETURN n.name AS user, u.name AS computer, u.has_path_to_da as has_path_to_da
users_admin_on_servers_2.scope_query: MATCH (n:User{enabled:true,is_da:false}) WHERE NOT n.name IS NULL RETURN count(n)

computers_admin_on_computers.name: Number of computers admin of computers
computers_admin_on_computers.request: CALL{MATCH (c1:Computer)-[r1:AdminTo]->(c2:Computer) WHERE c1.name IS NOT NULL AND c2.name IS NOT NULL AND c1 <> c2 RETURN c1.name AS source_computer, c2.name AS target_computer, c2.has_path_to_da AS has_path_to_da UNION ALL MATCH (c1:Computer)-[r2:MemberOf*1..4]->(g:Group)-[r3:AdminTo]->(c2:Computer) WHERE c1.name IS NOT NULL AND c2.name IS NOT NULL AND c1 <> c2 RETURN c1.name AS source_computer, c2.name AS target_computer, c2.has_path_to_da AS has_path_to_da}  RETURN distinct(source_computer), target_computer, has_path_to_da

kud.name: Shortest paths to objects configured for KUD
kud.request: MATCH (n) WHERE (n:Computer) OR (n:User AND n.enabled=true) WITH n ORDER BY n.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p=shortestPath((n)-[:$properties$*1..$recursive_level$]->(m{target_kud:true})) WHERE NOT n=m AND (((n.is_da IS NULL OR n.is_da=FALSE) AND (n.is_dc IS NULL OR n.is_dc=FALSE)) OR (NOT m.domain CONTAINS '.' + n.domain AND n.domain <> m.domain)) RETURN DISTINCT(p)
kud.scope_query: MATCH (n) WHERE (n:Computer OR (n:User AND n.enabled=true))  AND (n.is_da IS NULL OR n.is_da=FALSE)   AND (n.is_dc IS NULL OR n.is_dc=FALSE) RETURN count(n)

nb_computers_laps.name: Number of computers with laps
nb_computers_laps.request: MATCH (c:Computer) WHERE NOT c.name is NULL and NOT c.haslaps IS NULL AND toUpper(c.operatingsystem) CONTAINS 'WINDOWS' RETURN DISTINCT(c.domain) AS domain, toInteger(($extract_date$ - c.lastlogontimestamp)/86400) as lastLogon, c.name AS name, toString(c.haslaps) AS LAPS

can_read_laps.name: Objects allowed to read LAPS
can_read_laps.request: MATCH p = (n)-[r1:MemberOf*1..]->(g:Group)-[r2:GenericAll]->(t:Computer {haslaps:true}) RETURN distinct(n.domain) AS domain, n.name AS name

objects_to_dcsync.name: Objects to dcsync
objects_to_dcsync.request: MATCH (n{path_candidate:true}) WHERE n.can_dcsync IS NULL AND NOT n.name IS NULL WITH n ORDER BY n.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p = shortestPath((n)-[r:$properties$*1..$recursive_level$]->(target{can_dcsync:TRUE})) WHERE n<>target RETURN distinct(p) AS p
objects_to_dcsync.scope_query: MATCH (n{path_candidate:true}) WHERE n.can_dcsync IS NULL AND NOT n.name IS NULL RETURN count(n)

dom_admin_on_non_dc.name: Domain admin with session on non DC computers
dom_admin_on_non_dc.request: MATCH p=(c:Computer)-[r:HasSession]->(u:User{enabled:true, is_da:true}) WHERE NOT c.name IS NULL and NOT u.name IS NULL and NOT c.is_dc=True RETURN distinct(p) AS p

unpriv_to_dnsadmins.name: Unprivileged users with path to DNSAdmins
unpriv_to_dnsadmins.request: MATCH (u:User{path_candidate:true}) WITH u ORDER BY u.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p=(u)-[r:MemberOf*1..$recursive_level$]->(g:Group{is_dnsadmin:true}) RETURN distinct(p) AS p

rdp_access.name: Users with RDP-access to Computers
rdp_access.request: MATCH (u:User{enabled:true,is_da:false}) WITH u ORDER BY u.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 CALL {WITH u MATCH p=(u)-[r1:MemberOf*1..5]->(m:Group)-[r2:CanRDP]->(c:Computer) RETURN u.name as user, c.name as computer UNION ALL WITH u MATCH p=(u)-[r2:CanRDP]->(c:Computer) RETURN u.name as user, c.name as computer} RETURN DISTINCT user, computer

dc_impersonation.name: Non-domain admins that can directly or indirectly impersonate a Domain Controller
dc_impersonation.request: CALL{MATCH p=(u{ou_candidate:true})-[r:MemberOf*1..5]->(g:Group)-[r3:AddKeyCredentialLink|WriteProperty|GenericAll|GenericWrite|Owns|WriteDacl]->(m:Computer{is_dc:true}) RETURN p UNION ALL MATCH p=(u{ou_candidate:true})-[r3:AddKeyCredentialLink|WriteProperty|GenericAll|GenericWrite|Owns|WriteDacl]->(m:Computer{is_dc:true}) RETURN p }RETURN DISTINCT p

rbcd.name: RBCD attacks
rbcd.request: CALL{MATCH (u:User{enabled:true,is_da:false}) WHERE u.name IS NOT NULL WITH u ORDER BY u.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH (u:User{enabled:true,is_da:false})-[rr:MemberOf*1..5]->(g:Group)-[r:GenericAll|GenericWrite|WriteDACL|AllExtendedRights|Owns|AdminTo]->(m:Computer{is_server:true}) RETURN u as user, g.name as groupname, r, m UNION ALL MATCH (u:User{enabled:true,is_da:false}) WHERE u.name IS NOT NULL WITH u ORDER BY u.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH (u:User{enabled:true,is_da:false})-[r:GenericAll|GenericWrite|WriteDACL|AllExtendedRights|Owns|AdminTo]->(m:Computer{is_server:true}) RETURN u as user, "Direct (nogroup)" as groupname, r, m }RETURN distinct user.name as username, groupname, type(r) as acl, m.name as computername ORDER BY username, computername, acl

graph_rbcd.name: Builds RBCD attack path graph and sets is_rbcd_target attribute
graph_rbcd.request: CALL{ MATCH p1=(u:User{enabled:true,is_da:false})-[rr:MemberOf|AddMember*1..5]->(g:Group)-[r:GenericAll|GenericWrite|WriteDACL|AllExtendedRights|Owns|AdminTo]->(m:Computer{is_server:true}) SET m.is_rbcd_target=TRUE RETURN p1 as p UNION ALL MATCH p2=(u:User{enabled:true,is_da:false})-[r:GenericAll|GenericWrite|WriteDACL|AllExtendedRights|Owns|AdminTo]->(m:Computer{is_server:true}) SET m.is_rbcd_target=TRUE RETURN p2 as p } RETURN p

graph_rbcd_to_da.name: Builds RBCD targets to DA paths
graph_rbcd_to_da.request: MATCH (m:Computer{is_rbcd_target:true}) WHERE NOT m.name IS NULL WITH m ORDER BY m.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p = shortestPath((m)-[r:$properties$*1..$recursive_level$]->(g:Group{is_dag:true})) WHERE m<>g RETURN DISTINCT(p) as p
graph_rbcd_to_da.scope_query: MATCH (m:Computer{is_rbcd_target:true}) WHERE NOT m.name IS NULL RETURN count(m)

compromise_paths_of_OUs.name: Compromisable OUs
compromise_paths_of_OUs.request: MATCH (o:OU) WITH o ORDER BY o.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p=shortestPath((u{ou_candidate:true})-[:MemberOf|GenericAll|GenericWrite|Owns|WriteOwner|WriteDacl|WriteGPLink*1..8]->(o:OU)) SET o.vulnerable_OU = TRUE RETURN p

vulnerable_OU_impact.name: Impact of compromisable OUs
vulnerable_OU_impact.request: MATCH (o:OU{vulnerable_OU:true}) WITH o ORDER BY o.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p=shortestPath((o)-[:Contains|MemberOf*1..]->(e)) WHERE o <> e AND (e:User OR e:Computer) RETURN p

vuln_functional_level.name: Insufficient forest and domains functional levels. According to ANSSI (on a scale from 1 to 5, 5 being the better): the security level is at 1 if functional level (FL) <= Windows 2008 R2, at 3 if FL <= Windows 2012R2, at 4 if FL <= Windows 2016 / 2019 / 2022.
vuln_functional_level.request: MATCH (o:Domain) WHERE NOT(o.functionallevel IS NULL OR SIZE(o.functionallevel) < 1) RETURN CASE WHEN toUpper(o.functionallevel) CONTAINS "2000" OR toUpper(o.functionallevel) CONTAINS "2003" OR toUpper(o.functionallevel) CONTAINS "2008" OR toUpper(o.functionallevel) CONTAINS "2008 R2" THEN 1 WHEN toUpper(o.functionallevel) CONTAINS "2012 R2" THEN 2 WHEN toUpper(o.functionallevel) CONTAINS "2016" OR toUpper(o.functionallevel) CONTAINS "2018" OR toUpper(o.functionallevel) CONTAINS "2020" OR toUpper(o.functionallevel) CONTAINS "2022" THEN 5 END as `Level maturity`, o.distinguishedname as `Full name`, o.functionallevel as `Functional level`

vuln_sidhistory_dangerous.name: Accounts or groups with unexpected SID history
vuln_sidhistory_dangerous.request: MATCH(o1)-[r:HasSIDHistory]->(o2{is_da:true}) RETURN o1.domain as parent_domain, o1.name as name, o1.sidhistory as sidhistory

can_read_gmsapassword_of_adm.name: Objects allowed to read the GMSA of objects with admincount=True
can_read_gmsapassword_of_adm.request: CALL {MATCH (o{path_candidate:true}) WITH o ORDER BY o.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p=((o)-[:MemberOf*1..7]->(g:Group)-[:ReadGMSAPassword]->(u:User{is_admin:true})) WHERE o.name<>u.name RETURN DISTINCT(p) UNION ALL MATCH (o{path_candidate:true}) WITH o ORDER BY o.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p=((o)-[:ReadGMSAPassword]->(u:User{is_admin:true})) WHERE o.name<>u.name RETURN DISTINCT(p) } RETURN p

objects_to_operators_member.name: Unprivileged users with path to an Operator Member
objects_to_operators_member.request: MATCH (m:User{path_candidate:true}) WHERE NOT m.name CONTAINS "MSOL_" WITH m ORDER BY m.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p = shortestPath((m)-[r:$path_to_group_operators_props$*1..$recursive_level$]->(o:User{is_operator_member:true})) WHERE m<>o AND NOT m.name CONTAINS "MSOL_" AND ((o.is_da=true AND o.domain<>m.domain) OR (o.is_da=false)) RETURN DISTINCT(p) as p
objects_to_operators_member.scope_query: MATCH (m:User{path_candidate:true}) WHERE NOT m.name CONTAINS 'MSOL_' RETURN count(m)
objects_to_operators_member._comment: TODO: table with type, account name, is_da (star) and the number of path towards it

objects_to_operators_groups.name: Operator Member path to Operators Groups
objects_to_operators_groups.request: MATCH (m:User{is_operator_member:true}) WITH m ORDER BY m.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p = shortestPath((m)-[r:MemberOf*1..$recursive_level$]->(o:Group{is_group_operator:true})) WHERE NOT m.name CONTAINS "MSOL_" AND ((m.is_da=true AND o.domain<>m.domain) OR (m.is_da=false)) RETURN DISTINCT(p) as p
objects_to_operators_groups.scope_query: MATCH (m:User{is_operator_member:true}) WHERE NOT m.name CONTAINS 'MSOL_' RETURN count(m)
objects_to_operators_groups._comment: TODO: table with type, account name, is_da (star) and the number of path towards it

vuln_permissions_adminsdholder.name: Dangerous permissions on the adminSDHolder object
vuln_permissions_adminsdholder.request: MATCH (n:User{path_candidate:true}) WHERE NOT n.name CONTAINS "MSOL_" WITH n ORDER BY n.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p = shortestPath((n)-[r:$properties$*1..4]->(target1{is_adminsdholder:true})) WHERE n<>target1 AND NOT ANY(no in nodes(p) WHERE (no.is_da=true AND (no.domain=target1.domain OR target1.domain CONTAINS "." + no.domain))) RETURN distinct(p) AS p
vuln_permissions_adminsdholder.scope_query: MATCH (n:User{path_candidate:true}) WHERE NOT n.name CONTAINS 'MSOL_' RETURN count(n)
vuln_permissions_adminsdholder._comment: TODO : table with les adminsdholder + path with => X objects to SDHolder

da_to_da.name: Paths between two domain admins belonging to different domains
da_to_da.request: MATCH p=allShortestPaths((g:Group{is_dag:true})-[r:$properties$*1..$recursive_level$]->(gg:Group{is_dag:true})) WHERE g<>gg AND g.domain <> gg.domain RETURN p

anomaly_acl_1.name: anomaly_acl_1
anomaly_acl_1.request: MATCH (gg) WHERE NOT gg:Group with gg as g MATCH (g)-[r2{isacl:true}]->(n) WHERE ((g.is_da IS NULL OR g.is_da=FALSE) AND (g.is_dc IS NULL OR g.is_dc=FALSE)) OR (NOT n.domain CONTAINS '.' + g.domain AND n.domain <> g.domain) RETURN n.name,g.name,type(r2),LABELS(g)

anomaly_acl_2.name: anomaly_acl_2
anomaly_acl_2.request: MATCH (gg:Group) WHERE EXISTS(gg.members_count) with gg as g order by gg.members_count DESC MATCH (g)-[r2{isacl:true}]->(n) WHERE ((g.is_da IS NULL OR g.is_da=FALSE) AND (g.is_dc IS NULL OR g.is_dc=FALSE)) OR (NOT n.domain CONTAINS '.' + g.domain AND n.domain <> g.domain) RETURN g.members_count,n.name,g.name,type(r2),LABELS(g) order by g.members_count DESC

get_empty_groups.name: Returns empty groups
get_empty_groups.request: MATCH (g:Group) WHERE NOT EXISTS(()-[:MemberOf]->(g)) AND NOT g.distinguishedname CONTAINS 'CN=BUILTIN' RETURN g.name AS `Empty group`, COALESCE(g.distinguishedname, '-') AS `Full Reference`

get_empty_ous.name: Returns empty ous
get_empty_ous.request: MATCH (o:OU) WHERE NOT ()<-[:Contains]-(o) RETURN o.name AS `Empty Organizational Unit`, COALESCE(o.distinguishedname, '-') AS `Full Reference`

has_sid_history.name: Objects that have a SID History
has_sid_history.request: MATCH (a)-[r:HasSIDHistory]->(b) RETURN a.name AS `Has SID History`, LABELS(a) AS `Type_a`, b.name AS `Target`, LABELS(b) AS `Type_b`

unpriv_users_to_GPO_init.name: Initialization request for GPOs [WARNING: If this query is too slow, you can use --gpo_low]
unpriv_users_to_GPO_init.request: MATCH (n:User{path_candidate:true}) WHERE NOT n.name IS NULL AND NOT n.name CONTAINS "MSOL_" WITH n ORDER BY n.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p = shortestPath((n)-[r:MemberOf|AddSelf|WriteSPN|AddKeyCredentialLink|AddMember|AllExtendedRights|ForceChangePassword|GenericAll|GenericWrite|WriteDacl|WriteOwner|Owns*1..]->(g:GPO)) WHERE NOT n=g AND NOT g.name IS NULL RETURN p
unpriv_users_to_GPO_init.scope_query: MATCH (n:User{path_candidate:true}) WHERE NOT n.name IS NULL AND NOT n.name CONTAINS "MSOL_" RETURN count(n)
unpriv_users_to_GPO_init._comment: This is a request for the --gpo_low option

unpriv_users_to_GPO_user_enforced.name: Compromisable GPOs to users (enforced)
unpriv_users_to_GPO_user_enforced.request: MATCH (n:User{enabled:true}) WHERE n.name IS NOT NULL WITH n ORDER BY n.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p = (g:GPO{dangerous_inbound:true})-[r1:GPLink {enforced:true}]->(container2)-[r2:Contains*1..]->(n) RETURN p
unpriv_users_to_GPO_user_enforced.scope_query: MATCH (n:User{enabled:true}) WHERE n.name IS NOT NULL RETURN count(n)
unpriv_users_to_GPO_user_enforced._comment: This is a request for the --gpo_low option

unpriv_users_to_GPO_user_not_enforced.name: Compromisable GPOs to users (not enforced)
unpriv_users_to_GPO_user_not_enforced.request: MATCH (n:User{enabled:true}) WHERE n.name IS NOT NULL WITH n ORDER BY n.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p = (g:GPO{dangerous_inbound:true})-[r1:GPLink{enforced:false}]->(container1)-[r2:Contains*1..]->(n) WHERE NONE(x in NODES(p) WHERE x.blocksinheritance = true AND (x:OU)) RETURN p
unpriv_users_to_GPO_user_not_enforced.scope_query: MATCH (n:User{enabled:true}) WHERE n.name IS NOT NULL RETURN count(n)
unpriv_users_to_GPO_user_not_enforced._comment: This is a request for the --gpo_low option

unpriv_users_to_GPO_computer_enforced.name: Compromisable GPOs to computers (enforced)
unpriv_users_to_GPO_computer_enforced.request: MATCH (n:Computer) WITH n ORDER BY n.name WITH n SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p = (g:GPO{dangerous_inbound:true})-[r1:GPLink {enforced:true}]->(container2)-[r2:Contains*1..]->(n) RETURN p
unpriv_users_to_GPO_computer_enforced._comment: This is a request for the --gpo_low option

unpriv_users_to_GPO_computer_not_enforce.name: Compromisable GPOs to computers (not enforced)
unpriv_users_to_GPO_computer_not_enforce.request: MATCH (n:Computer) WITH n ORDER BY n.name WITH n SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 MATCH p = (g:GPO{dangerous_inbound:true})-[r1:GPLink{enforced:false}]->(container1)-[r2:Contains*1..]->(n) WHERE NONE(x in NODES(p) WHERE x.blocksinheritance = true AND (x:OU)) RETURN p
unpriv_users_to_GPO_computer_not_enforce._comment: This is a request for the --gpo_low option

unpriv_users_to_GPO.name: Non privileged users to GPO
unpriv_users_to_GPO.request: MATCH (g:GPO) WITH g ORDER BY g.name SKIP PARAM1 LIMIT PARAM2 OPTIONAL MATCH (g)-[r1:GPLink {enforced:false}]->(container1) WITH g,container1 OPTIONAL MATCH (g)-[r2:GPLink {enforced:true}]->(container2) WITH g,container1,container2 OPTIONAL MATCH p = (g)-[r1:GPLink]->(container1)-[r2:Contains*1..8]->(n1:Computer) WHERE NONE(x in NODES(p) WHERE x.blocksinheritance = true AND (x:OU)) WITH g,p,container2,n1 OPTIONAL MATCH p2 = (g)-[r1:GPLink]->(container2)-[r2:Contains*1..8]->(n2:Computer) RETURN p
unpriv_users_to_GPO._comment: this is the normal version of the GPO request

cross_domain_local_admins.name: Users that are local admins cross-domain
cross_domain_local_admins.request: MATCH p1=(u{enabled:true})-[r:MemberOf*1..4]->(g:Group{is_admin:true})-[rr:AdminTo]->(c:Computer) WHERE c.ghost_computer IS NULL AND u.domain <> c.domain AND NOT c.domain CONTAINS u.domain WITH collect(distinct p1) as paths OPTIONAL MATCH q=(u{enabled:true})-[r:AdminTo]->(c:Computer) WHERE c.ghost_computer IS NULL AND u.domain <> c.domain AND NOT c.domain CONTAINS u.domain WITH paths + collect(distinct q) as allPaths UNWIND allPaths as p RETURN DISTINCT p

cross_domain_domain_admins.name: Users that are domain admins cross-domain
cross_domain_domain_admins.request: MATCH p=(u{enabled:true})-[r:MemberOf*1..4]->(g:Group{is_da:true}) WHERE u.domain <> g.domain AND NOT g.domain CONTAINS u.domain return p

primaryGroupID_lower_than_1000.name: User with PrimaryGroupID lower than 1000
primaryGroupID_lower_than_1000.request: MATCH (n) WHERE (n:Group OR n:User) AND toInteger(split(n.objectid, "-")[-1]) < 1000 AND (n.enabled = true or n:Group) return toInteger(split(n.objectid, "-")[-1]) as sid, n.name, n.domain, n.is_da

pre_windows_2000_compatible_access_group.name: Pre-Windows 2000 Compatible Access contains unauthenticated users
pre_windows_2000_compatible_access_group.request: MATCH (n:Group) WHERE n.name STARTS WITH "PRE-WINDOWS 2000 COMPATIBLE ACCESS@" MATCH (m)-[r:MemberOf]->(n) WHERE NOT m.objectid ENDS WITH "-S-1-5-11" return m.domain, m.name, m.objectid, labels(m) as type

guest_accounts.name: Guest accounts enabled
guest_accounts.request: MATCH (n:User) WHERE n.objectid ENDS WITH "-501" RETURN n.name, n.domain, n.enabled

unpriviledged_users_with_admincount.name: Unpriviledged users with admincount=1
unpriviledged_users_with_admincount.request: MATCH (u:User{enabled:true}) WHERE u.is_da=false AND u.admincount=true RETURN u.name, u.domain, u.da_type

get_fgpp.name: FGPP applied to users directly or via groups
get_fgpp.request: MATCH (u:User) WHERE u.fgpp_name IS NOT NULL RETURN u.fgpp_msds_psoappliesto, u.fgpp_name, u.fgpp_msds_minimumpasswordlength, u.fgpp_msds_minimumpasswordage, u.fgpp_msds_maximumpasswordage, u.fgpp_msds_passwordreversibleencryptionenabled, u.fgpp_msds_passwordhistorylength, u.fgpp_msds_passwordcomplexityenabled, u.fgpp_msds_lockoutduration, u.fgpp_msds_lockoutthreshold, u.fgpp_msds_lockoutobservationwindow

azure_set_gag.name: Set gag=TRUE to Global admin group
azure_set_gag.request: MATCH (a:AZRole) WHERE a.name STARTS WITH 'GLOBAL ADMINISTRATOR@' SET a.is_gag=TRUE

azure_user.name: Get Azure Users
azure_user.request: MATCH (n:AZUser) RETURN n.name AS Name, n.tenantid AS `Tenant ID`, n.onpremisesyncenabled AS onpremisesynced, n.onpremisesecurityidentifier AS SID

azure_admin.name: Get Azure Admins
azure_admin.request: MATCH p =(n)-[r:AZGlobalAdmin*1..]->(m) RETURN n.name AS Name, n.tenantid AS `Tenant ID`

azure_groups.name: get Azure Groups
azure_groups.request: MATCH (n:AZGroup) RETURN n.tenantid AS `Tenant ID`, n.name AS Name, COALESCE(n.description, '-') AS Description

azure_vm.name: get Azure VM
azure_vm.request: MATCH (n:AZVM) RETURN n.tenantid AS `Tenant ID`, n.name AS Name, n.operatingsystem AS os

azure_users_paths_high_target.name: Find all Azure Users with a Path to High Value Targets
azure_users_paths_high_target.request: MATCH (m:AZUser),(n {highvalue:true}),p=shortestPath((m)-[r:$properties$*1..$recursive_level$]->(n)) WHERE NOT m=n RETURN p

azure_ms_graph_controllers.name: Return all direct Controllers of MS Graph

azure_aadconnect_users.name: Return all Users and Azure Users possibly related to AADConnect
azure_aadconnect_users.request: MATCH (u) WHERE (u:User OR u:AZUser) AND (u.name =~ '(?i)^MSOL_|.*AADConnect.*' OR u.userprincipalname =~ '(?i)^sync_.*') OPTIONAL MATCH (u)-[:HasSession]->(s:Session) RETURN u.name AS Name, s AS Session, u.tenantid AS `Tenant ID`

azure_admin_on_prem.name: Return all Azure admins that are also on premise admins
azure_admin_on_prem.request: MATCH (a:AZUser)-[r:AZGlobalAdmin]->(),(u:User{is_da:true}) where a.onpremisesecurityidentifier=u.objectid return u.name as Name

azure_role_listing.name: List of all Azure roles
azure_role_listing.request: MATCH (a:AZRole) return distinct a.name AS Name, a.description AS Description

azure_reset_passwd.name: Azure accounts that can reset passwords

azure_last_passwd_change.name: Last password change on Azure and on premise
azure_last_passwd_change.request: MATCH (u:User {enabled:TRUE}),(a:AZUser) WHERE a.onpremisesecurityidentifier = u.objectid RETURN DISTINCT(u.name) AS Name, toInteger(($extract_date$ - u.pwdlastset )/ 86400) AS `Last password set on premise`, toInteger(($extract_date$ - (datetime('1970-01-01T00:00:00').epochMillis + duration.inSeconds(datetime('1970-01-01T00:00:00'), a.pwdlastset).seconds)) / 86400) AS `Last password set on Azure`

azure_dormant_accounts.name: Azure dormant accounts
azure_dormant_accounts.request: MATCH (a:AZUser),(u:User {enabled:TRUE}) WHERE a.onpremisesecurityidentifier = u.objectid RETURN a.name AS Name, toInteger(($extract_date$ - u.lastlogontimestamp)/86400) AS lastlogon, toInteger(($extract_date$ - u.whencreated)/86400) AS whencreated

azure_accounts_disabled_on_prem.name: Azure accounts that are disabled on premise
azure_accounts_disabled_on_prem.request: MATCH (a:AZUser{enabled:TRUE}),(u:User{enabled:FALSE}) WHERE a.onpremisesecurityidentifier = u.objectid RETURN a.name AS `Azure name`, a.enabled AS `Enabled on Azure`, u.name AS `On premise name`, u.enabled AS `Enabled on premise` UNION MATCH (a:AZUser{enabled:FALSE}),(u:User{enabled:TRUE}) WHERE a.onpremisesecurityidentifier = u.objectid RETURN a.name AS `Azure name`, a.enabled AS `Enabled on Azure`, u.name AS `On premise name`, u.enabled AS `Enabled on premise`

azure_accounts_not_found_on_prem.name: Azure accounts that are synced but do not exist on premise
azure_accounts_not_found_on_prem.request: MATCH (azUser:AZUser{onpremisesyncenabled:true}) WHERE NOT EXISTS {MATCH (user:User) WHERE user.objectid = azUser.onpremisesecurityidentifier} return azUser.name AS Name

azure_tenants.name: Get all Azure tenants
azure_tenants.request: MATCH (t:AZTenant) RETURN t.name AS Name, t.tenantid AS ID

azure_ga_to_ga.name: Paths between two global admins belonging to different tenants
azure_ga_to_ga.request: MATCH p=allShortestPaths((g:AZRole{is_gag:TRUE})-[r:$properties$*1..$recursive_level$]->(gg:AZRole{is_gag:TRUE})) WHERE g<>gg AND g.tenantid <> gg.tenantid RETURN p

azure_cross_ga_da.name: Paths between tenants admin and domain admins
azure_cross_ga_da.request: MATCH p=allShortestPaths((g:AZRole{is_gag:TRUE})-[r:$properties$*1..$recursive_level$]->(gg:Group{is_dag:TRUE})) RETURN p UNION MATCH p=allShortestPaths((gg:Group{is_dag:TRUE})-[r:$properties$*1..$recursive_level$]->(g:AZRole{is_gag:TRUE})) RETURN p
